result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Cabrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Comply with family court (CHIPS) orders. 
-----------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Cabrera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda L Cabrera in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

1:15 CALL:  COURT REPORTER AT THIS TIME:  Sandra Elderbrook.  

Atty Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Amanda L Cabrera in court with Atty Rebecca Hammock. 
Matter is before the Court for plea and sentencing.  
Atty Hammock recites terms of the plea agreement.  
State files Amended Criminal Complaint charging 3 misdemeanors.  
Court notes that it typically does not accept a withheld sentence on misdemeanor charges.  
Court will take a recess on this matter to allow Atty Hammock to discuss this matter with ADA Johnson and Ms. Cabrera.
Case can be recalled at the time of the 2:30 final pre-trials on the Court's calendar today.

2:24 PM - Case recalled.  COURT REPORTER AT THIS TIME:  RHONDA BOSS

Atty Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Amanda L Cabrera in court with Atty Rebecca Hammock. 
Parties now have an agreement worked out for an imposed and stayed sentence. 
Atty Hammock recites the revised plea agreement that has been reached
Plea questionnaire is filed.  
Court has plea colloquy with the Defendant.  
Deft enters Guilty pleas to Counts #1, #2 and #3 of the Amended Complaint.  
Court inquires if the Deft wishes to make a statement.  
Response by Defendant
Court has concerns about proceeding based upon the stmts being made by the Deft and proposes a further recess to allow Atty Hammock to speak with her client.  
2:30 pm  Court in recess

**NOTE (OFF THE COURT RECORD):  After having further discussions with her client, Atty Hammock requested this case be put on Monday's 1:15 pm Call for plea and sentencing

Defendant Amanda L Cabrera in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR.  Defendant Amanda L Cabrera in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both sides confirm they are ready to proceed to trial.  Court will come back to this case later in the call after addressing the other cases on the final pre-trial calendar.  CASE RECALLED OFF THE COURT RECORD:  Parties advise they have reached an agreement and now ask that it be set for plea and sentencing in the next couple of weeks.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Amanda L Cabrera in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

941 am case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Amanda L Cabrera in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock. ADA Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court reviews preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver with defendant. 
Defendant bound over for trial. 
Information filed. Not guilty plea entered. Status hearing scheduled. Motion deadline. 
944 am court in recess.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda L Cabrera in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant to be booked and printed on Thursday 08/27/2015.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.L.C. DOB 11/29/2007 OR WITH MICHAEL OR VICTORIA LEISHER.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Amanda L Cabrera appeared, Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
